column1: GK^What is a Bellwether^Leader of flock of sheep
GK^What was Procul Harem's greatest hit^Whiter shade of pale
GK^Percy Shaw invented what in 1934^Cats eyes
GK^What animal produces its own sun tan lotion^Hippopotamus
GK^What was a Nuremberg egg^Pocket watch or clock
GK^What was the name of Isaac Newton's dog - caused fire in lab^Diamond
GK^Who was eaten by dogs in the Old Testament^Jezebel
GK^In literature who is the alter ego of Percy Blakney^Scarlet Pimpernel
GK^Juglans Regia is the real name of what type of nut tree^Walnut
GK^What album cover (by the Rolling Stones) had a zip on the side^Sticky Fingers
GK^What lives in a holt^An Otter
GK^Who is the Patron Saint of dancers and actors^St Vitas
GK^What is the worlds tallest grass^Bamboo
GK^Who owned the newspaper in Lou Grant - Nancy Marchand^Mrs Pyncheron
GK^Who reputedly first said - if in doubt tell the truth^Mark Twain
GK^John Richie became famous under what name^Sid Vicious
GK^In Greek mythology who rowed the dead across the river Styx^Charon
GK^Alfred White was a famous author under which name^James Herriot
GK^Which acid was first prepared from distilled red ants^Formic acid
GK^Who invented doctor Who^Terry Nation
GK^What took place on London's serpentine first time 16 June 1930^Mixed Bathing
GK^Which European city was the bride of the sea^Venice
GK^Who (not Peter Sellers) played Inspector Clouseau in 1968^Alan Arkin
GK^Where could you find the Lutine Bell^Lloyds of London
GK^Yabusame is the Japanese version of what sport^Archery
GK^Which Dickens novel is considered an autobiography^David Copperfield
GK^Dendrologists worship what^Trees
GK^What is the national sport of Finland^Motor Rallying
GK^Who was Agrippa's son^Nero
GK^Peter Goldmak invented what in 1948^LP record
GK^Milton lost which sense^Sight
GK^What are camel haired brushes made of^Squirrels tails
GK^How did the Greek dramatist Aeschalys die^Eagle dropped tortoise on head
GK^Playing card - Raymond Shaw trance - Manchurian Candidate^Queen Diamonds
GK^Eiffel designed the Eiffel tower - what was his first name^Gustave
GK^The Salk vaccine is used against what disease^Polio
GK^If you are born between June 23rd and July 23rd what star sign^Cancer
GK^An alloy of Iron - Chromium and Nickel makes what^Stainless Steel
GK^Who said "Public service is my motto"^Al Capone
GK^Drakes Golden Hind was originally called what^The Pelican

GK^What did the Victorians call servant regulators^Alarm Clocks
GK^Which country first used the fountain pen^Egypt
GK^What is the more popular name for the Londonderry Air^Danny Boy
GK^Freyr was the Norse god of what^Fertility
GK^TAP is the national airline of which country^Portugal
GK^In which country is the port of Frey Bentos^Uruguay
GK^The Koh-i-Nor is a famous diamond - what does the name mean^Mountain of Light
GK^A nilometer measures the rise and fall of what^Rivers
GK^What was Britain's first colony (annexed in 1583)^Newfoundland
